article.headline: Mobley connects on all five 3-point attempts
article.linkText: Mobley's long-range show lifts College of Charleston
article.story: KENT, Ohio (AP) -- Rashard Turner scored 21 points and Kent State opened its season Friday with a 111-52 rout of Houghton, a NAIA school. Turner hit 7-of-9 shots from the floor, including 4-of-6 from 3-point range. Clif Brown added 16 points and Scott Cutley and Jason Edwin had 13 apiece for Kent State. Houghton (1-2) was led by Jason Lee's 13 points. Justin Pauley, Joel Hamilton and Eric Jankov each had seven points. Kent State never trailed, going ahead 6-0 as Houghton had three turnovers, a shot blocked and missed a jumper, layup, 3-point shot and free throw in the first two minutes. The Golden Flashes led 58-28 at halftime. It was the third biggest margin of victory for Kent State, which beat St. Joseph's of Indiana by 65 points (119-54) and Wilberforce by 60 points (110-50), both in 1998.
